sentence.Network_en: A conflagration in 1947 reduced 90 percent of the houses to ashes.
sentence.Network_cn: 1947年的一场大火,使90%的房屋化为灰烬.

sentence.Network_en: The light of that conflagration will fade away.
sentence.Network_cn: 这熊熊烈火会渐渐熄灭.

sentence.Network_en: Competitors quickly tried to douse another conflagration of iPhone hype.
sentence.Network_cn: 很快竞争者就试图加入到另一轮iPhone的广告战.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (denoting consumption by fire): from Latin conflagratio(n-), from the verb conflagrare, from con- (expressing intensive force) + flagrare 'to blaze'

entry.def: A conflagration is a fire that burns over a large area and destroys property.

means.word_mean: 1. a very intense and uncontrolled fire

stems_affixes.word_buile: con全部+flagr火焰+ant表形容词→全部是火→大火的
flagr火焰+ant表形容词→燃烧的→罪恶像火一样燃烧→恶名昭彰的
con全部+flagr火焰+ation表名词→全部是火→大火灾

stems_affixes.value_cn: 极恶昭彰, 臭名远扬, 名目张胆
stems_affixes.word_buile: flagr火焰+ancy表名词→燃烧→罪恶像火一样燃烧→恶名昭彰
de加强+flagr火焰+ate使……→加大火焰→爆燃
